p: Currently, epidemiological models are used by many international agencies, including the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Centers for Disease Control (CDC), for large-scale, multi-faceted analysis required to propose and validate multi-national targeted layered containment policies as well as prophylactic measures (Epstein 2009; Ferguson et al. 2006; Longini et al. 2005; Rao et al. 2007a). Such epidemiological analysis is performed using detailed, stochastic models that involve complex, symbiotic interactions between the various entities involved in the simulation.
